Author: jl777c#5810
Content: pushed fix for osx compiler issue

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, on exit from the program, it will wait for the most recent keystrokes tx to confirm. that can take a few minutes as it waits for new blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can check in keystrokes.log the txid of what it is waiting for confirm. it does a sendrawtransaction in a loop to help it propagate and get mined

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so far I have not heard of any keystrokes tx failures, so maybe it is good enough reliability? the next level of reliability will take a lot longer to implement. also not sure if at the end it needs to wait for confirmation

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
It seems fine.
At the moment I'm just waiting for a next block before bailout - I think I can check if last keystroke for current game have > 0 confirmations and only after it make bailout to make it more reliable

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i removed the waiting for last tx at the end of the program as that is indeed something the TUI can do, though the bailout should work even if the keystrokes is in the mempool.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: For now TUI can "cut" last keystroke easily I wonder

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: one trick for a stubborn tx that stays unconfirmed is to sendrawtransaction once per 10 seconds or so until it gets an "already in the blockchain" error

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: latest also has a rogue.sendlog file it makes to log the results of the sendrawtransctions it does

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so if there are troubles, at least there should be a log of it
